full_threads.body:
Hey @andy - Sophie wanted to ask if you are available for Friday QA.

Here is my draft:

Hi Sophie,

Thanks for the update everything’s coming together nicely!

A few quick notes on next steps:
  • Backlink updates: We can absolutely get started this week on the test site. That’s usually the smoothest route so we can QA things early and avoid any last-minute rush. Just send through the login details when you’re ready.
  • QA testing: Happy to lock in some time this Friday. Just let me know what time works best once your copy is ready.

Let me know if anything else comes up , always happy to help.

This ticket has been idle for over 24 hours.

If you need to respond to the client, please create a new conversation and close this ticket. Once the new ticket is created, continue the conversation there.

For guidance, refer to this walkthrough: 
  • https://www.loom.com/share/238808eaaeaa428a80a85441547b7e50?sid=1e84bd29-3621-4f82-8dac-5237bd08e5a5
  • https://www.loom.com/share/b1f338d04eb44b118d915b107a6ed087?sid=1dbc4938-b676-4cd2-a748-5692874039dc

Yes thanks so much Allie this information is really helpful!

Hi Andy - on the below



  1. QA testing - I would love your help with this. Could we book this in say Friday this week I just want to get some of the copy refined before we start the process. We plan to launch next Friday the 15th of August.



  2. Cookies - thanks so much for the recommendation- I will take a look today and get out developers to apply this with the design and required copy from Microsoft Clarity. Am leaning towards Complianz as we are a global financial services business. Will check them out today.



  3. ReCAPTCHA - thanks for adding the developers to the accounts





  1. Backlinks updates - are you able to do this now while we are in staging or does it make sense to book this in to do on launch day 15 August? Assume I just need to give you log in to the test site - if we can start this week great! I will just get business approval for this today but your support here makes complete sense to me.



Many thanks again
Sophie
Sophie O'Neill

Senior Marketing Manager

P +61 2 8248 8000

Level 6, 143 Macquarie Street | Sydney NSW 2000, Australia

investmenttrends.com

(I work Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday)

Thanks Allie!

Hi Sophie,

One more thing - if you're interested in me doing a QA of the site before finalized, just let me know when ready for review.

I'll assume that this is the latest - https://niwart.tech/investmenttrends/

Thanks and look forward to helping get the new site live and performing!

Thanks again,
Andy

Hi Sophie,

Happy Friday!

Thank you so much for letting us know.

Here are some quick notes based on your questions:
  • Cookie pop-up tools:
  • For financial services compliance, I’d recommend:
    • Cookiebot – strong compliance features, automatic scanning, and easy WordPress integration.
    • Complianz – WordPress-native and built to support GDPR, UK-GDPR, and ePrivacy.
    • OneTrust – more of an enterprise solution, widely used in regulated industries.
Each of these can meet the requirements when properly configured, especially with explicit consent messaging.

  • Microsoft Clarity & compliance:
    Clarity itself doesn’t handle consent directly, but it can be used in a compliant way if the cookie banner is set up to secure explicit user consent before Clarity loads. This setup is essential for GDPR and ePrivacy compliance, especially in financial services.
    Microsoft addresses this here: Clarity cookie consent setup
    As long as we handle that part correctly, Clarity can be used within the required legal boundaries. Let me know if you'd like us to double-check the current setup.

  • reCAPTCHA access:
  • Both developers have been added to the account:
    • ivan@niwart.io
    • magerram.gubadov@niwart.io

  • Backlink updates:
  • We can absolutely help with updating the older articles. Here's a quick breakdown:
    • You have 120 minutes available in your plan for August
    • Overages are billed at $109/hour
    • If it’s around 100 articles, we estimate about 300 minutes total

Let us know if you’d like us to go ahead with the backlink updates, or if you’d prefer a more detailed quote first.

Great to hear you’re making some updates to the news page, happy to support on that whenever you’re ready.

And if anything else comes up or you have any questions, we’ll jump in and help—always happy to support.

1. Cookie Pop-up Tool for Financial Services Compliance
For a financial services firm, it's crucial to stay fully GDPR and ePrivacy Directive compliant. I’d recommend:
  • Cookiebot – A strong choice with automatic cookie scanning, easy WordPress integration, and solid compliance coverage.
  • Complianz – A WordPress-native plugin tailored for GDPR, UK-GDPR, and ePrivacy. Good for firms that want a self-contained WordPress setup.
  • OneTrust – While not a WordPress plugin, it’s a leading enterprise solution. It integrates via script or Tag Manager and is widely used in regulated industries.
Each of these can meet the compliance needs of a financial services company when configured correctly.

2. Microsoft Clarity & Compliance Concerns
Clarity is a useful tool for heatmaps and session recordings, but it doesn’t offer full user consent handling out of the box. That means you’ll need to integrate it properly with your cookie consent tool, ensuring it doesn’t load until the user has explicitly opted in (particularly for analytics cookies).
Used correctly (e.g. via Cookiebot or Complianz integrations), it can be compliant — but messaging and control must be tight. If you'd like, I can review how it’s currently integrated to confirm compliance.

  1. Yes we've added it here-

    4. that will depend but if the backlink is around 100 maybe 2 hours

On Thu, Jul 31, 2025 at 2:37 PM Sophie O'Neill <s.oneill@investmenttrends.com> wrote:
Hi Andy

Thank for the chat today - some quick questions!

  1. Wondered if you could recommend a Cookies pop up tool that offers the right amount of compliance for a financial services company? Any recommendations would be helpful.
  2. Just on heatmap tools and compliance - are you guys comfortable that Microsoft Clarity covers all of our legal obligations as a financial services provider if we message our cookies pop up correctly? I read that they may not have full permissions to collect data.
  3. Also do you have the log in to our reCAPTCHA account I would like to give access to our developers. Their emails are:

ivan@niwart.io
magerram.gubadov@niwart.io

  1. If I wanted you guys to update the last few years of articles on our new site with backlinks - there could be 100 or so - are you able to do this as a one off cost?
Note on the news page I am going to try and make those upgrades first to the panel but would be good to know what the potential cost may be?

Many thanks
Sophie
